title: Function: Height of a Released Object
prompt:
The function f(x) = − 16x2 + 112 models the height, in feet, of an
object x seconds after it was released. What was the height of the
object 1.5 seconds after it was released?
hint: Isolate the variable term first, and then the variable.
feedback:
<math display='block'>
 <mtable columnalign='left'>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>Substitute </mtext><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mtext> into the function:</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mi>f</mi><mo stretchy='false'>(</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo stretchy='false'>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn><msup>
     <mrow><mo>(</mo>
      <mrow>
       <mn>1.5</mn></mrow>
     <mo>)</mo></mrow>
     <mn>2</mn>
    </msup>
    <mo>+</mo><mn>112</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn><mo stretchy='false'>(</mo><mn>2.25</mn><mo stretchy='false'>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>112</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>36</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>112</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>76</mn>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>The object was 76 feet high, 1</mtext><mtext>.5 seconds after it was released</mtext><mtext>.</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
 </mtable>
 
</math>
